description:
Enter the 24th Ward, a man-made island inside Tokyo Bay. Three of its inhabitants: Shuuta, Ran, and Kouki, have been best friends since childhood, but after a deadly incident, everything changed. A year later, reunited for the first time, they receive a mysterious phone call. On the other line is a familiar voice—from a friend who’s supposed to be dead. Together, they’ll have to save their home.

(Source: Funimation)

Note: The first episode was a 1-hour special.
synonyms: โตเกียวเขต 24

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

node.description:
[Website](https://hideyukifukasawa.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/eicheph) | [Blog](https://eicheph.blogspot.com/)

Hideyuki Fukasawa is a Japanese composer. He has often worked with [Capcom](https://anilist.co/staff/109955/Capcom) but is also involved in his freelance composing work. He had a minor role in Onimusha 2 as an assistant sound engineer and programmer to [Taro Iwashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/100948/Tarou-Iwashiro), the acclaimed music composer of that particular game but it was his work on Chaos Legion, a Capcom Gothic action-adventure third-person fighting game in a similar fashion with the Devil May Cry series released in 2002, that gave him a cult-like status among video gaming fans. In 2008 he composed and arranged the music for Street Fighter IV, Marvel vs Capcom 3: Fate of Two Worlds, and the updated versions of both said games, with some tracks arranged from previous games.

He was the main composer for [TYPE-MOON's](https://anilist.co/staff/97582/TypeMoon) remake of the visual novel Tsukihime. 

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Chaos Legion (Video Game, 2003) (Composer)
- Onimusha: Dawn of Dreams (Video Game, 2006) (Composer)
- Street Fighter IV (Video Game, 2008) (Composer)
- Marvel vs. Capcom 3: Fate of Two Worlds (Video Game, 2011) (Composer)
- Street Fighter X Tekken (Video Game, 2012) (Composer)
- Witch on the Holy Night (Visual Novel, 2012) (Composer)
- Street Fighter V (Video Game, 2016) (Composer)
- TSUKIHIME -A piece of blue glass moon- (Visual Novel, 2021) (Composer) !~

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/331643934) | [Website](http://mazurka.moo.jp/)

While studying for a university degree in art, she was discovered by web artists [Shingo Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/114914/) and [Kenichi Kutsuna](https://anilist.co/staff/116007/), who recruited her to work on [Birdy Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/). She did not join any particular studio, but started her career as a freelancer.
Director of the Finishing Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/skm2y_1121)

Director of the Photography Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

After moving to Tokyo, Sakuma initially joined Azuhata Production, where he gained some experience before joining [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/) in 2009. There he took part in the production of [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/), and later made his debut as director of photography on [Saint Onii-san](https://anilist.co/anime/15775/).

node.description:
[Website](https://survivesaidtheprophet.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/SSTPofficial) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/survivesaidtheprophet) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/survivesaidtheprophet) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SSTPOFFICIAL)

__Biography__
Survive Said The Prophet commonly known as “SABAPURO” is formed in Tokyo, Japan in 2011. A native English speaker / bilingual vocalist, Yosh’s overwhelming singing ability and charisma at the head, it’s a miracle international rock band that consists of five talented, musicianship, and original characters. Their outstanding musicality is based on the wide background not limited to rock but also pop, electro, hip hop and R&B to place their field of activities in various fields using its diversity as a weapon that doesn’t fit in the frame of an existing scene and continues to evolve every day.

__Current Members__
- [Yoshiya Morita](https://anilist.co/staff/219035/Yosh) (Yosh) - vocal
- Tatsuya Kato - guitar
- [Ivan Kwong](https://anilist.co/staff/288633) - guitar
- Show Okada - drums

__Former Members__
- Takuya Suzuki - guitar (resigned in 2015)
- Kei Tatsuno - drums
- Yuki Hanazawa - support bassist, dirty vocal
- Yudai Kato - bass, scream (resigned in 2021)

(Sources: Survive Said the Prophet official website and Wikipedia)

__Agency:__ Atomic Monkey

[Profile](http://www.atomicmonkey.jp/jp/archives/talent/enokijunya) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/enojunjunjun) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%A6%8E%E6%9C%A8%E6%B7%B3%E5%BC%A5)

Junya Enoki is a Japanese voice actor affiliated with Atomic Monkey. His hobbies are boxing and kendo. Enoki became interested in acting while in college after watching the anime Gurren Lagann. He's a cousin of [Chika Anzai](https://anilist.co/staff/106030).

__Non-Anime Roles:__ ~!
Caelus in "Honkai: Star Rail" (VG)!~

__Height:__ 174 cm

[Profile](https://stay-luck.com/talent/ishikawa-kaito/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ish_kaito) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/apatyai1013) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ishi_kaito1013/)

**Non-Anime Roles:**
• Marius von Hagen (Tears of Themis)
• Il Fado de Rie (Cafe Enchante)
• Adam (Bustafellows)
• Lucien Neuschburn (even if Tempest)
• Laurier (Nekopara -Catboys Paradise-)
